programme.title: If You're Listening Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Donald Trump was ordered to pay a $463.9 million fine for lying to banks about how rich he is. He faces at least five other cases that could cost him millions more. Can he make it to election day without running out of money?

programme.title: Four Corners Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Inside Israel's war machine. John Lyons asks the tough questions; challenging some of Israel's most powerful political and military voices about the country's strategy and intentions. Is there any way out of this war?

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing Ep48
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Live from Parliament House in Canberra, Greg Jennett brings you everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs today, speaking with the key decision makers and stakeholders on issues in the news.

programme.title: ABC News with Joe O'Brien Ep68
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Joe O'Brien brings you a comprehensive summary of the day's events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on what's going on.

programme.title: Strait To The Plate Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Aaron Fa'Aoso comes home to Saibai island to reconnect with family, learn new contemporary dishes and indulge in some of his old favourites.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 4 - Tiana and Sam sit down with Samoan International and Rugby League veteran Joseph Paulo. Plus Tahina Booth talks about her Grass Skirts program confronting health and well-being across the Pacific.

programme.title: ABC National News Ep94
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and the day's stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Joe O'Brien.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep51
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight Ep68
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - More news, more often - the home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the issues that matter. The ABC's network of reporters cover important stories and bring you news and information you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The Business Ep39
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Australia's leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: The World Ep55
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - There's never been a more important time to stay in touch with what's happening in our world. Now at the new earlier time of 9pm AEDT, Beverley O'Connor presents the latest international news from correspondents and guests.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - School striker Anjali Sharma sued the government at 16. Now she's taking her fight for an end to fossil fuels to federal parliament, and the powerbrokers are listening.

programme.title: Project Wild Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Nature nerd, Dr Ann Jones travels through the Indo-Pacific region to find the dedicated people bringing our planet's amazing animals, plants and ecosystems back from the brink. This time Ann explores the Kingdom of Tonga.

programme.title: Adam And Poh's Malaysia In Australia Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Starting their journey in Tasmania, Adam and Poh head out to find some of the best seafood in the world. From there Adam heads to Bendigo. Back in the kitchen Adam and Poh cook Lobster Sambal and Lobster Otak-otak.

programme.title: Khanh Ong's Wild Food Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Chef Khanh Ong embarks on an epic road trip through Central Gippsland, Victoria. He learns how to forage for ingredients for a wild salad, harvest mushrooms and create spice blends from native ingredients.

programme.title: Strait To The Plate Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Aaron Fa'Aoso comes home to Saibai island to reconnect with family, learn new contemporary dishes and indulge in some of his old favourites.

programme.title: ABC Late News Ep68
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Know the latest on the day's top stories, as Jade Barker brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep51
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 4 - Tiana and Sam sit down with Samoan International and Rugby League veteran Joseph Paulo. Plus Tahina Booth talks about her Grass Skirts program confronting health and well-being across the Pacific.

programme.title: The Cook Up With Adam Liaw Bitesize Ep9
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Chef Adam Liaw runs through the best tips and tricks on how to do a chicken in a pot whole, including how to stack vegetables for the best flavours.

programme.title: Dream Gardens Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Young professionals Stuart and Monique Cormack are desperate to reinvent their tiny, neglected backyard. Will their big dreams fit their pint-sized, terrace garden?

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 32 - Millie Ross visits an indigenous plant propagation expert, Costa Georgiadis creates a polystyrene palace for worms, Jerry Coleby-Williams dives into the war on weeds, and Jane Edmanson visits a fruitful family farm.

programme.title: ABC Late News Ep68
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Follow the story with the latest on today's news, explaining what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe covering what you need to know. Presented by Jade Barker in Perth.

programme.title: The Business Ep39
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Australia's leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep51
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: The World Ep55
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - There's never been a more important time to stay in touch with what's happening in our world. Now at the new earlier time of 9pm AEDT, Beverley O'Connor presents the latest international news from correspondents and guests.

programme.title: News Breakfast Ep69
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Be the first to know the latest overnight developments, breaking news and the day's top stories. Michael Rowland and Lisa Millar bring you news and interviews, joined by Bridget Brennan, Tony Armstrong and Emma Rebellato.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep69
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - When big stories break, turn to Dan Bourchier in the morning to bring you what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has more reporters in more places, serving and connecting communities and telling your stories.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep69
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the day's top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 32 - Jerry Coleby-Williams has tips for living with possums, Millie Ross celebrates our love of pears, Josh Byrne grows colourful natives in pots, and Guest Presenter Luke Mitchell joins us with a lesson on restoring old tools.

programme.title: Stuff The British Stole Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Marc Fennell unravels the true history of the Koh I Noor diamond which sits at the heart of the Crown Jewels. But beyond the glitz, he reveals the tragedy of a 10-year-old Sikh boy ripped from his mother and kingdom.

programme.title: UFC Main Event EpUFC283TeixeiravsHill

programme.title: MotoGP : Grande Prémio de Portugal Highlights
programme.desc: MotoGP : Grande Prmio de Portugal Highlights - The circuit was inaugurated by WorldSBK when they headed to Portugal for their final round of that season but its not just a racetrack. The Algarve Motorsports Park is a state-of-the-art complex which boasts the stunning race track, a go-kart track, an off-road park, a hotel, an apartment complex, a technology park and a sports complex it really is the bees knees. In terms of the actual circuit layout, the Autodromo Internacional do Algarve has 15 corners nine right, six left. The undulation in Portimao is incredible and the front straight will allow the MotoGP riders to really stretch the legs of their machines, before a unique downhill descend into Turn 1. Theres a reason it gets called a high-speed rollercoaster, its a thrill for riders and fans alike.

programme.title: 2023-2024 KOVO V-League Women
programme.desc: Hi-Pass vs Red Sparks - The 20th season of the KOVO V-League Women sees reigning champions EX Hi-pass defend their title against six fellow professional volleyball teams for the coveted championship in South Korea.

programme.title: LALIGA LEGENDS PEP GUARDIOLA
programme.desc: LALIGA LEGENDS PEP GUARDIOLA - More than a title-winning machine, Pep Guardiola changed the face of football. Trace the evolution of his famed tiki-taka style of play that propelled the likes of Messi, Xavi, Iniesta and Busquets to footballing royalty.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Blanchfield vs. Fiorot
programme.desc: Prelims - A flyweight title shot may be on the line at Atlantic Citys Boardwalk Hall on March 30 when New Jerseys own Erin Cold Blooded Blanchfield faces French sensation Manon Fiorot in the five-round main event of UFC Fight Night. With a combined UFC record of 12-0, Blanchfield and Fiorot have been on a tear at 125 pounds, and with one more win in AC, a crack at the crown is expected to be next. Plus, Westwood native Vicente Luque continues on his quest to rule the welterweights when he battles highlight reel king Joaquin Buckley in what promises to be a memorable co-main event

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Ribas vs. Namajunas
programme.desc: Prelims - A top ten contender in two weight classes, dynamic Brazilian star Amanda Ribas will make her case for a move into the flyweight title conversation when she competes in her first UFC main event against former world champion Rose Namajunas at the APEX in Las Vegas on March 24. Fresh from a Performance of the Night knockout of Luana Pinheiro, Ribas is ready for the biggest fight of her career against Namajunas, a world champion at 115 pounds now seeking gold in the flyweight division
